titleStmt.title: William T. Samuels to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4859

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Auditor's Office, Kentucky.
WILLIAM T. SAMUELS,
Attorney at Law & General Collecting Agent,
FRANKFORT, KY.
&#9758 Special attention given to collection of all claims confided to him throughout the State of Kentucky.
WILLIAM T. SAMUELS, Auditor.
EDGAR KENNON, Ass't Auditor.
James M. Withrow, Clerk.
Uberto Keenon, Clerk.
R. R. Bacon, Clerk.
John A Crittenden, Clerk.
Jno. W. Pruett, Jr., Clerk.
Charles T. Miller, Clerk.
John L. Sneed.Frankfort, Ky., April 30th, 1864.
Hon Tho. E. Bramlete
Gov. of Ky.
Dr. Sir

R. S. Peters, Clerk of the Washington Co. Co. paid on the 26' January 1864 the amt of the Execution with Interest and cost against him as Clk. of said court & now prays to be relieved from the paymt. of Seventy Eight 59/100 Dollars, that being the amount adjudged against as damages for failing to pay into the Treasury, the amout of Revenue in his hand as clerk in time as required by law.

Franklin Cir Ct
vs
R L Peters Clk
of $78.59
Damages
Remit damages
Tho E Bramlette
30th Apl/64
